title: Hey Riot! Can you touch up some of the older legendary skins?
body:
I know there's a lot of legendary skins with very hefty price tags on them (20.00), but some of the older ones aren't up to par with the new ones. Maybe instead of releasing 750 skins with no particle changing effects and animations, you should revisit some of these classic skins to give them a better feel for the people who have spent lots of their money on them. I was gifted Alien Invader Heimerdinger, and I just ended up feeling disappointed. It changed nothing but the model and the turrets and left me feeling unsatisfied. At lease give us something pretty to look at for such rarities. Some of the "Ugliest" skins in league happen to be legendary, as they don't have the excuse of being "cheap". They come off as outdated and ugly to look at.
For Example: https://i.ytimg.com/vi/8svC76Vaqmw/hqdefault.jpg
Nobody likes this skin, as it has nothing changed except the base model... and It costs $20.00. Imagine all of the things you could buy for $20.00! Lunch at an expensive restaurant, new clothes, 5 league skins, and In Canada you can buy... well... not much. Anyways, all jokes aside; instead of releasing skin after skin, maybe Riot should revisit some of the Legacy/Legendary skins, and keep them up to date with the current Graphics and price Value. Riot, We are giving you our money; just give us something pretty in return. 
http://i.qkme.me/3pnhdz.jpg

Riot has said MANY MANY times that they have no interest in updating skins unless its for a full on champ rework like tarics.

I know, but to be quite frank, a lot of the champions with expensive trashy skins don't need a rework. They just look ugly, but their playstyle is good. For such a hefty price tag, Riot should be willing to spend a bit of time reworking the legendary skins at least. It's just... disappointing

That's why these skins aren't available at all times. They are poor quality when applied to today's standards, so they go into the vault. They are then made available at certain times to make people want to buy them _"Oh its expensive, its exclusive, It would be cool to have this."_ Due to them being in the vault they probably sell more of them now than they would have without the existence of a vault. Riot can go along saying _"Yeah these skins are poor quality so they've been removed from the store"_ and still get sales at the same time. 

The reason they will never be updated without a full champion VU is because then you're basically giving all of the people who own it a fancy new skin for _free_, and odds are anyone who would be willing to buy a **cool expensive** skin for a specific champion would be willing to buy an **exclusive expensive** skin for a champion, and even though they put in time and resource into a cool new skin they wouldn't see very many sales.

I get that... but come on

But they didn't do anything to Twisted Fate (specifically the Magnificent skin) with his VU several years ago  :(

It's not just the legendary skins, though. On all tiers, there are outliers that are very skewed in their prices.
To use a legendary skin as an example, Firefighter Trist was way cool when it was released because having a different auto was so unique. Compared to Dragon Trainer Trist, though, which is the same price, DT obviously has a lot more.
To use non-legendary skins as an example, Exiled Morg is a 975 RP skin that is little more than a recolor. Compare that to Ghost Bride Morg, which is 3 years old (exactly three years old today, actually, according to the wiki) but still has much more.
Lots of people complain about how Pulsefire Ez is worse than a lot of his other skins.
So yes, several older skins--in all price tiers--should be updated to better reflect their cost.
It's worth noting that with Taric's update, his Emerald skin got changed to more than just the recolor it was and kept its 520 RP price. As the game progresses, prices of old skins become more and more inconsistent for what you get.

This was addressed a few years ago.  Riot's stance is that the game has evolved since those skins were released, and so they accurately reflected the price compared to other skins released at that time.  In other words, back when a recolor cost you 975 and a good recolor was 1350, a whole new model was totally worth it.

Now that base skins have back animations and multiple lines, these older skins really show their age.  It's sad, but would the effort to remake these skins be worth it, since Riot would basically have to make a new legendary skin for each?  Or would you rather be getting legendary skins for other champions?
I would rather them make the legendary skins they have be good. If they don't have the time to do that, at least reduce the prices to appropriately reflect what the skin offers.
